{"step_by_step_thinking": "The vertebral column is made up of individual bones called vertebrae. There are 33 vertebrae in total, which are divided into different regions. The cervical region has 7 vertebrae, the thoracic region has 12 vertebrae, the lumbar region has 5 vertebrae, the sacral region has 5 fused vertebrae, and the coccygeal region has 4 fused vertebrae. Adding up all these numbers, we get a total of 33 vertebrae.", "answer_choice": "B"}
